newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Playmates' Chan family in court squabble.
newsitem.headline: Playmates' Chan family in court squabble.

text.p: Albert Chan, a former director of Playmates Investments Ltd, has petitioned the High Court to wind up the company, the Hong Kong Economic Times reported on Tuesday.
Playmates Investments owns 66.5 percent of Playmates Toys, which introduced the internationally successful Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles dolls, and of Prestige Properties.
Albert Chan holds 32.5 percent of Playmates Investments, while his younger brother Thomas, who is managing director of both listed companies, holds 57.5 percent.
The older brother alleges in his petition that Thomas Chan has stopped him from participating in the management of the Playmates group, the newspaper said.
A court hearing was expected to last eight weeks, it said.
Playmates officials on Tuesday morning refused to discuss details of the case but said the group would make a public statement later.
Shares of Playmates Toys were down 19 cents to HK$1.75 at midday.
Prestige Properties fell six cents to HK$1.06.
